node.contents: Thanks for your reply. I'm not repackaging the mail.jar, I'm using it as it came from this link https://code.google.com/p/javamail-android/downloads/list - So everything should remain referenced.

astNode.text: Thanks for your reply. I'm not repackaging the mail.jar, I'm using it as it came from this link https://code.google.com/p/javamail-android/downloads/list - So everything should remain referenced.

node.contents: I don't know what Proguard is, but it sounds like it's pulling the class files out of mail.jar and adding them to your jar. Unfortunately, it's not including the configuration files that are in the mail.jar file. You need the files from META-INF in the mail.jar file. Or better yet, don't repackage mail.jar, just use it as is.

astNode.text: I don't know what Proguard is, but it sounds like it's pulling the class files out of mail.jar and adding them to your jar. Unfortunately, it's not including the configuration files that are in the mail.jar file. You need the files from META-INF in the mail.jar file. Or better yet, don't repackage mail.jar, just use it as is.

node.contents: Usually this error occurs because of incorrect "mail.jar".

astNode.text: Usually this error occurs because of incorrect "mail.jar".

node.contents: Solution:

astNode.text: Solution:

node.contents: 1] Check if "mail.jar" is in your classpath.

astNode.text: 1] Check if "mail.jar" is in your classpath.

node.contents: 2] If its there in the classpath,Check for the latest version of "mail.jar" and then include it in your classpath.

astNode.text: 2] If its there in the classpath,Check for the latest version of "mail.jar" and then include it in your classpath.
